findings.title: TCG activated unlocked range vulnerability
findings.description: The binding between PIN_KEK ANON and DEKs allows decryption of arbitrary locked ranges without a password. The proposed fix removes this binding, making it impossible to recover PIN_KEK without a correct user password.

findings.title: TCG to ATA cross mode vulnerability
findings.description: Vulnerability in mode switch function that generates a new ATA KEK and clears out the old PIN_KEK ANON, invoked by any switch between TCG and ATA security.
findings.function: primary function responsible for handling the mode switch

findings.title: ATA Maximum capability mode Master password issue
findings.description: Previously, the Master password PIN_KEK was not cleared when switching to Maximum capability mode. The fix involves encrypting the PIN_KEK MASTER using a SHA256 hash of the user password as the key and storing it in the PIN_KEK ANON slot, then zeroing PIN_KEK MASTER.

findings.title: Limitations of PIN_KEK ANON remediation
findings.description: The PIN_KEK ANON remediation prevents decryption of arbitrary locked ranges without a password, but it does not attempt to address the case of multiple locked ranges with different passwords.
